adjective.description: Situated in or towards the south.
Of a wind: blowing from the south; = "southerly". Now somewhat rare.
Designating people inhabiting or originating from the southern part of a country or region.

adverb.description: In the south; towards the south, in a southerly direction.

origin: Late 16th century. From southern + -ly, probably partly as alteration of southerly<br>late 16th century; earliest use found in Thomas Blundeville (fl. 1561), author and translator. From southern + -ly, probably partly as alteration of southerly.
